# Draft:Kwara Kiddies League

The Kwara Kiddies League (formerly known as Kwara U12 YEG League) is a grassroots youth football league based in Kwara State, Nigeria. It is owned and managed by Kwara Kiddies YEG League Limited, with a core mission of engaging young people positively through structured football competition and academic development.
Overview
Established in 2022, the league initially began as the Kwara U12 YEG League and was later renamed to better reflect its broader vision. The league is open to footballers aged 15 and under, registered with grassroots football academies across four local government areas in Kwara State.
The competition adopts a Home/Away format, with matches played at the Kwara Football Academy Arena. A key component of the league is its commitment to balancing athletic and academic development, ensuring participating children—who are school-aged—are also supported in their education.
The league is governed and coordinated by a management entity known as The League Board (TLB).

Mission and Objectives
The mission of the league is to provide a safe, structured, and positive environment where young footballers can develop on and off the pitch. The league aims to:
Create a foundation for future professional football talent. Encourage academic excellence alongside sporting talent. Offer leadership and character development for participants. Serve as a model for grassroots football development in Nigeria.
Sponsorship and Partnerships
In June 2024, the league signed a four-year sponsorship agreement with Taiwo Awoniyi, Nigerian international and striker for Nottingham Forest (England). This partnership marked a significant milestone in the league's development and visibility
Legacy and Impact
The kwara-based football league is rapidly establishing itself as a model for youth football development in Nigeria. By combining structured competition with educational and leadership development, KKL is not only shaping future footballers but also empowering future leaders through the power of sport. The most valuable player of the 2022 edition of the league, Ahmad Kewugbemi secured a scholarship from Seyi Akinwumi Foundation while the 2023 edition most valuable player,  Fuhad Abdulsalam earned a call up to the National U-15 football team also known as Future Eagles in 2024 and participated in the WAFU-B U15 tournament in Niger Republic.
